title: How does one distinguish a truth from the reality? - Quora

response.answer_text: Truth is a relationship between two concrete-entities within the real-world. Reality functions whether we choose to observe it or not. Discernment is a skill-set just like rocket-science, practicing-medicine, and brain-surgery. ‘High-Offices’ to undertake for sure, but you get the point. Frames-of-refrence have to be provided in a safe-environment that can contain the potential-disasters of success and failure equally. Success? You ask. Well yes, sometimes we shoot ourselves in the foot for taking a successful-application of a ‘skill-set’ for granted and mistake success for competency. Without competency, we self-sabotage ourselves into low-self-esteem, which can only be remedied by old-fashioned-discipline, perseverance, and unfortunately time. All well worth it, and the money doesn’t hurt anything either.
What I'd truth: your belief What is reality: the tangible by- product of your actions If your actions are in line with your beliefs then the world(result) becomes positive(perceptively)
Truth and reality are the same thing. If you say what is, is, then you speak the truth. If you say what is, is not, then you speak falsely.
